Header: Petition against Singapore FTA postponed for Jan. 09th
Content: The Supreme Court today decided to take up eight petitions filed seeking a court order pronouncing that the Sri Lanka-Singapore Free Trade Agreement is against the Constitution, will be taken up for consideration on January 09th. Eight persons including Parliamentarian Bandula Gunawardena have filed these petitions. The respondents cited are members of the Cabinet including the Prime Minister and the Attorney General. The petitioners have mentioned that if the Free Trade Agreement concerned was implemented it would have a serious impact on professionals serving in many sectors including the Medical, Engineering, Law and Surveying fields in the country.
